intro: Euphrasia × occidentalis, commonly known as the Western eyebright, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia × occidentalis is often found in regions of western North America, where it thrives in temperate climates.
